heading: nasdaq soars, dow up slightly
subheading: net stocks propel the nasdaq to another record close. tmp worldwide's monster.com signs a $us100 million deal with aol, and tmp leaps 32 points.
author: reuters
text: stocks rose thursday, with the nasdaq market climbing another record as wall street bet there will be no bad news in friday's monthly jobs report. the market also got a late boost from comments by federal reserve bank of st. louis president william poole that he was comfortable with the current level of us inflation.the dow jones industrial average ended up 40.67 points, or 0.37 percent, at 11,039.06.the technology-heavy nasdaq composite index shot up 99.05 points, or 2.95 percent, to 3,452.76, beating the old record close of 3,447.81 set on 26 november.the s&p 500 index rose 11.32 points, or 0.81 percent, to 1,409.04."people have a sense of confidence, and mood and momentum are helping money flow into the market," said alan ackerman, market strategist for fahnestock & co.in the broader market, advancing issues led declines by a small margin on active volume of 895 million shares on the new york stock exchange.investors expect friday's jobs report, which plays a big role in the making of the federal reserve's monetary policy, will show the nation's labor market stayed hot in the month leading up to the big christmas season in december.economists surveyed by reuters expect the economy created 226,000 new jobs in november -- on top of the robust addition of 310,000 in october.the unemployment rate, already at a 30-year-low of 4.1 percent, is expected to hold steady, while another rise in wage growth is likely after an increase in october.analysts expect the fed will not raise interest rates a fourth time this year when its policy-setting group -- the federal open market committee -- meets on 21 december. the thinking is that the fed will not want to add to wall street's anxieties about the year 2000 computer bug.meanwhile, st. louis fed chief poole said the indicators pointing to a rise in inflation are mixed and that there is no convincing evidence that any relief is in sight for the tight us jobs market."the signposts are mixed and are pointing in different directions. we are more or less in the right ballpark," poole said.among stocks in the news, america online (aol) rose 3 11/16 to 79 15/16 after it signed an exclusive four-year us$100 million deal with tmp worldwide's (tmpw) online recruiter monster.com. tmp jumped 32 1/16 to 127 1/16 after painewebber set a $145 price target for the stock.intel (intc) the world's largest computer chip maker, said it found a bug in some chips in its new pentium iii family that interferes with the boot-up process of pcs. intel ended with a gain of 1 1/4 at 77 9/16 after rallying from a low of 75 1/2.boeing (ba) engineers and technical workers overwhelmingly rejected the company's contract offer and approved a strike authorization. boeing stock fell 1 9/16 to 40 1/16.mattel (mat) stock was down 1/2 at 13 3/4 after the wall street journal reported the company's online toy sales efforts have stalled, due to differences over how to create a business model that would split profits with major retailers.copyright
